definition: 1. One devoted to virtu; one skilled in the fine arts, in antiquities, and the like; a collector or ardent admirer of curiosities, etc. Virtuoso the Italians call a man who loves the noble arts, and is a critic in them. Dryden. 2. (Mus.)  A performer on some instrument, as the violin or the piano, who excels in the technical part of his art; a brilliant concert player.
